org.semanticweb.rulewerk.core.model.implementation

Class Expressions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.semanticweb.rulewerk.core.model.implementation.Expressions

  • public final class Expressions
extends Object
    This utilities class provides static methods for creating terms and formulas in Rulewerk.
    Author:
    Markus Kr√∂tzsch

        public static DatatypeConstant makeDatatypeConstant(String lexicalValue,
                                                    String datatypeIri)
        Creates a DatatypeConstant from the given input.
        Parameters:
        lexicalValue - the lexical representation of the data value
        datatypeIri - the full absolute IRI of the datatype of this literal
        Returns:
        a DatatypeConstant corresponding to the input.

      • makeLanguageStringConstant

        public static LanguageStringConstant makeLanguageStringConstant(String string,
                                                                String languageTag)
        Creates a LanguageStringConstant from the given input.
        Parameters:
        string - the string value of the constant
        languageTag - the BCP 47 language tag of the constant; should be in lower case
        Returns:
        a LanguageStringConstant corresponding to the input.

      • makeFact

        public static Fact makeFact(String predicateName,
                            List<Term> terms)
        Creates a Fact.
        Parameters:
        predicateName - non-blank Predicate name
        terms - non-empty, non-null list of non-null terms that are constants
        Returns:
        a Fact with given terms and Predicate constructed from name given predicateName and arity given terms size.

      • makeFact

        public static Fact makeFact(Predicate predicate,
                            List<Term> terms)
        Creates a Fact.
        Parameters:
        predicate - a non-null Predicate
        terms - non-empty, non-null list of non-null terms. List size must be the same as the given predicate arity.
        Returns:
        a Fact corresponding to the input.
